Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the person in the photo with Bill Clinton is actually Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand, not Christine Blasey Ford.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of a photo of Bill Clinton with Dr. Ford, when in reality, no such photo exists.
Understate: There is no understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by wrongly identifying Christine Blasey Ford as the person in the photo with Bill Clinton.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or proof provided to support the existence of the photo.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that a photo of Bill Clinton with Dr. Ford exists, when it is actually a misidentified photo of Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation.
